Fearing that an outsider would notice your new attire, you responded quickly, "No! Thanks, I think regular water can handle this!" You deftly grabbed a napkin and dabbed at the imaginary stain, attempting to mitigate further embarrassment.

Shifting in your new clothes, you felt a creeping sensation in your groin as your new underwear was really pinching your package. Wondering how far these changes had gone, you reached for your pocket. Searching for your pocket, you grabbed only at air, before you realized that your dress would be "pocket free". Scanning the table, you realized that the sequined purse to your left no longer belonged to your mother, but was now your property. Quickly grabbing it up, you announced that you'd be going to the bathroom to freshen up before the main meal arrived.

As you hop up, you’re surprised to not wobble at all on your new shoes. Apparently, in this new “reality” you had been walking in heels for years.

“I’ll go with you, I can always stand to powder my nose.” Your sister announces.

As you two approach the bathrooms, you hesitate, as you aren’t sure if the world views you as a male or female. Reaching into your purse, you find your ID. Scanning quickly, you recognize a greatly feminized version of your picture and see that your gender is listed as “Female”.

“Guess that answers that,” you mumble.

“What was that sis?” your sister says as she tugs on your elbow, pulling you towards the ladies restroom.

“Nothing! Just checking that I brought my lip-gloss tonight, I’ve been forgetting it lately.” You quickly reply.

“Well glad you have it, a girl should never be without good lip-gloss. It really can be the accent that makes your face ‘pop’.” She says as she pushes the lavatory door open and heads for a stall.

“I haven’t told you yet, but I love your outfit tonight. You have such a distinct sense of style.” She says over her shoulder before locking the door behind her.

You aren’t sure how to respond. In your male life, communication was kept to a minimum in the bathroom. Usually constrained to grunts, nods, and discussion on sports, you are taken aback.

As you look in the mirror, your sister continues the one-way conversation.

“How have you been? We need to plan a ‘girl’s day’ soon, we haven’t done one in so long.” She says.

Grasping the sink, you look in the mirror. Your reflection is that of a male made up in the fashion of an older, sophisticated socialite that your mother represented until about 10 min ago.

Shaking you from your daze, you hear your sister proclaim, “Oh shoot! Oh sis, there isn’t any TP in this stall. Can you be a dear and hand me some under the wall?” as she finishes her request, you see her slender hand reach under the partition grasping for a lifeline.

Your friends are wearing skimpy bathing suits that do nothing to disguise their private parts. What this means is that Gloria's breasts are practically popping out of the Ariel suit, while Lisa's teddy bear shirt is stretched beyond recognition.

You decide to keep your eyes on Janet as she finishes the steaks.

"Come and get it!" she exclaims, bringing the meat over to a picnic table. Feeling almost naked in Lisa's black bikini, you nevertheless scramble over for some food. Partially, you're starving, but you're also eager to see how your friends and the girls will treat each other. You know from the way you were treated in the bathroom and even earlier that people seem to have a tendency to see themselves and others in a way that matches their clothing. With that in mind, you're unsurprised to catch a passing dude leering at you while you're bending over to get a steak.

"I like your bathing suit," Lisa murmurs shyly from beside you. As if she hadn't been wearing it herself just minutes before. You give her a wane smile that hides how you really feel: bewilderment at what has happened, generally, and specifically frustration because Lisa and the other girls so obviously view you with the same mixture of envy and admiration younger girls reserve for older and more developed ones.

The weird thing is that Lisa and the others are even eating like young teens - a little awkwardly, and smearing BBQ sauce on their lips. Realizing that you have changed as well, you find yourself nibbling on smaller portions, and have to fight the urge to wipe the corner of Lisa's mouth with a napkin.

Meanwhile, Gloria and Lisa giggle and talk about Justin Bieber.

Janet, at least, is trying to look more mature. With the steaks done, she's removed Bob's white t shirt, and you have to avoid staring at the way the smaller bikini shows off most of her chest. You see her trading whispers with Jordan and Steve from across the picnic table.

When she gets up to take the leftovers away with Bob, your other two friends exchange knowing glances.

"What's going on?" you're almost afraid to ask.

"Come to the bathroom with us and we'll tell you," Jordan says, his eyes shifting to Gloria and Lisa, still trapped in their conversation.

The two of them get up and nod to Bob, who is just returning. "Can you watch the girls while we go change?" Steve says.

At Bob's assent, the three of you head toward the bathroom and changing station. Jordan and Steve have matching pink bags slung over their shoulders they must have retrieved from somewhere just before the steaks were done. You're thinking it is kind of odd that this will be the second time today you and Jordan have changed out of girls' swim suits.

Even stranger is the fact that your friends are headed right into the women's side of the changing area, and you have little choice but to follow them there.

1322212122.content:
It's getting really hot out. Underneath your t shirt, the swimsuit clings to your sweaty body. You already regret not taking it off when you had the chance.

More slowly this time, you make another pass through the duffel bag, studiously ignoring the cotton bra and panties. You squeeze your eyes against another wave of dizziness, then almost drop the bag in shock as a memory flickers in your mind of going to the mall to get the bra with your mom last month. You recall standing in the change room with her, topless and embarrassed, while a saleswoman wrapped a length of tape over your growing chest. Both of them are taller than you. You feel your face flush as they pass knowing glances back and forth.

"Gah! That never happened," you gasp. On impulse, you pull out the picture of you with your friends, the same ones you went to the beach with today. Now that you're prepared for it, the image of yourself in the purple dress is no longer so shocking. But then you take another look at your friends and notice they're also wearing girl clothes! It looks like the photo was taken at some kind of school dance, one you don't remember attending. Certainly not dressed that way.

Unable to examine the photograph any further, you try to fix your gaze on the beach. The sudden movement of your eyes and head leaves you swaying, and things that you could see clearly in the distance are now blurred, with tiny black spots dancing in front of them.

Suddenly, you hear someone calling your name from behind. You turn, ready to respond, but the world seems to keep turning, like it's getting away from you. You toss the duffel bag on the ground, in front of you, just as your legs give way, and it prevents your face from hitting the ground as you fall.

You awake to a cold blast of air and a babble of conversation.

All around you, people are talking. The voices are familiar, but through the noise you have difficulty focusing on any one in particular. But you get the sense that everyone is concerned.

Now in a sitting position, you kick your feet, only to feel them strike against the underside of the car's front seat. Now the voices go quiet, except for one. "Phillip?" she says. "Are you awake?"

You groan as the air conditioning is suddenly switched off. "Mom?"

"I'm here. You had a bit of a fall, sweetie."

You're about to comment on the weird dream you were just having, but the stretch of the girl's swimsuit across your shoulders and over your chest brings you back to reality. You shake your head.

"How are you feeling?" your mom says from the front seat.

"... thirsty." You have a hard time meeting her eyes. You can't imagine what she's thinking, seeing you dressed this way.

After she hands you a bottle of water, you quickly look yourself over. It's worse than you had thought. At some point, probably to cool you off, your shirt and shorts had been removed, leaving you clad only in the swimsuit. The colorful ruffles seem to mock you beneath your mom's concerned stare.

You quickly try to think up some excuse for your attire, but nothing comes to mind.

For months, now, your mom has been bugging you to move the rest of your stuff out of your room. Every week, you fill a box and put it in the attic, the closet, or your dorm room on campus. The last you saw of it, your room was basically empty, except for some old clothing you were planning to give away, and a few other odds and ends.

It's not empty now. But it's not exactly your room anymore, either. Or is it?

The walls are pink. They were white before. The bed is covered with a pink quilt and various stuffed animals.

The floor is kind of a mess. You step over a pair of white cotton panties just to get inside. A hardcover version of some teen book about vampires is propping open the closet door. The inside of the closet is stuffed with clothing like it never was before, most of it extremely feminine.

Where your computer desk once stood is a table with a mirror. The table contains scattered tubes of lip gloss, mascara, and a few framed photographs. Below the table is a well-worn book bag, with the corner of a textbook peeking out.

Feeling almost like an intruder, you cautiously inspect one of the photos. It is a picture of you with a huge grin on your face. It's hard to tell, but it looks like you're wearing a tutu and tights in the photo, and the sheen of sweat on your forehead makes you think it was taken after a period of physical exertion. The problem is, you know you've never dressed like that, nor danced in a ballet.

Creeped out, you return the photo to the table face down and drop yourself onto the bed.

1322212122111221.content:
"Phyllis, I need to talk to you," your mom calls.

The way your life is going, you think about ignoring the summons. After all, you're either asleep or you've gone crazy, and neither would require you to pay much attention to the demands of your mother.

But even as you're deliberating, you find yourself getting to your feet and heading out of the bedroom. The sundress, softly lapping against your legs, feels just as weird in its own way as the bathing suit did. At least it covers more of you.

In the kitchen, your mom is chopping vegetables and humming a tune. She looks up when you enter the room and frowns.

"Why aren't you wearing a bra?"

"I... I don't need one," you try.

Your mom sighs. "Of course you do, dear. We've talked about this already. You are getting too developed in the chest to go out without one."

Under her stern glare, you turn sheepishly and head back upstairs. While going up, you wonder what would have happened if you'd pulled off your dress and flashed your flat chest at her. Would she have relented then?

Probably not.

Getting the bra on is less trouble than you expected. It's white and cotton and fits you better than a bra should. Compared to the band size, which has adjusted to fit over your broader shoulders and back, the cup size is small. In the mirror, the way the features of the bra work together makes it look like you have the beginning of small, conical breasts under those cups. They even wobble when you shake your torso.

Underneath, below your waist, the panties hide any bulge between your now hairless thighs.

You don't exactly look like a 13 year old girl, but you certainly look more feminine than before. It must be these clothes.

With a shrug, you throw the sundress back on, only to find it makes the illusion of your breasts even more prevalent.

With your mom calling you again, you descend the steps and enter the kitchen.

"That's better," she announces, tossing some onions into a pot of water.

"What can I do for you, mother?" you say. You never called her mother before, but it somehow seems appropriate.

You talk about how you are feeling since leaving the beach and you let her know you are feeling better.

"That's good," she says. "Would you be up for babysitting for the Hendersons tonight like you had planned?"

The Hendersons have one child. You've never babysat for them before, but you figure this must be part of what has changed about your life along with all your clothing. Sitting doesn't sound very appealing to you, but it would at least be a chance to earn some money. There weren't any bank or credit cards in that handbag, after all.

You don't put it this bluntly to your mom, of course. Instead, you just feign weakness from your fall on the beach, and she nods sympathetically before going back to making dinner.

On the couch in the living room, you contemplate your situation. You now have the life of a thirteen year old girl. Your college plans are gone and if what you suspect is true on Monday you will be back in junior high. Except this time, you'll be wearing the girls' uniform.

You're despondent, and under the circumstances there is only one person you know who might be able to help you, or at least provide some consolation.

Linda is your girlfriend. Sort of. Maybe ex-girlfriend would be a better term. The last time you spoke, she had expressed her displeasure that you were planning on leaving town to go to college. She said that it would be better, perhaps, if you didn't see each other any more. That's why she wasn't at the beach. But you know she's smart and resourceful, and if anyone can figure out what's going on, she can.

Besides, it's about time you figured out what this change did to your relationship with her.

Thinking back, you remember seeing a pink cell phone fall out of the bag along with all your other stuff. It's still lying on the bed upstairs.

You get the phone and sit back on the bed. The contacts list is much shorter than the one on your old phone. Your mom's number is at the top, followed by a few other relatives and friends you recognize, and some you don't. Fortunately, Linda's number is still listed, and you hold your breath as the phone rings.

Then someone picks up. "Hello?" a familiar voice says.

1322212122111221212.content:
"Who is this?"

Your heart falls when Linda doesn't immediately recognize your voice. "It's me," you croak. "Phil."

It's at least five seconds before she responds, but you can hear her breathing.

"Phil?" she wonders. "You mean Phyllis, don't you? The girl I used to babysit?"

Only the uncertainty in her tone allows you to persevere. "No. Phillip Parker. Your... your old boyfriend."

More silence. You hear your mom moving around downstairs.

"Phil, um... this is really weird." She sounds like she wants to believe you. "We had a fight, didn't we?"

Profoundly relieved, you grin wildly and throw your legs onto the bed. "You're remembering!"

"Sort of," she admits. "When I hear your voice, I keep getting flashes of someone else. A little girl I babysat years ago, when I was thirteen and fourteen. She used to sit in my lap and I'd read her a story."

You think back to the changed photographs and to the way your mom was treating you. Linda's memories were changed, but she'd kept at least a flicker of the old you. She'd at least remembered about the fight you'd had.

"I need to see you." The sudden declaration makes your chest pound. "I need to sort out the conflicting feelings I'm having. Can we meet at the mall?"

The thought of being out in public, with the world treating you like a girl, makes you nauseous. At the same time, you realize you can't wait to see Linda again, and you just know you'll be able to help her realize your real identity. In that respect, meeting at the mall seems like a great plan, and you tell Linda so.

She names a store and tells you she'll be there in an hour. You'll have to miss dinner, but hopefully your mom will understand. You tell her you'll be there one more time, and then, with the words almost sticking in your throat, you say it:

"I love you, Linda."

There is a sharp intake of breath, and then the call ends.

Almost jumping for joy, you rush out of your room and downstairs to ask your mom for permission to go to the mall.
1322212122111221212.title: She remembers. Kinda.

13222121221112212121.content:
You're about to ask your mom for the car keys when you remember you no longer have a driver's license.

Walking it is, then, you think, looping your handbag over your shoulder as you leave the house behind. Fortunately, your mom's easy-going nature hasn't changed with your wardrobe, and she readily gave her permission for you to go to the mall. Better than that, she gave you a twenty to spend in any way you wanted. The only condition was that you had to promise to call her for a ride if you left the mall after nine.

It's windy enough to make you regret leaving the sundress on. Worse than that, every time a car goes by, the updraft goes straight up your legs, a discomforting sensation you can't believe you're feeling.

At one point, a passing car actually slows down. You look up in pleasant surprise, only to see the four guys in the car leering at you as they slip by. One of them, undoubtedly close to your (real) age shouts out "Show us your tits!" just as the vehicle passes over a hill and out of view.

Nasty. And nothing you can do about it, either. Even if the car had stopped, throwing the passengers the middle finger might just have irritated them. And what if they'd gotten out, planning to teach the impudent thirteen year old girl a lesson?

It doesn't matter, really, that your body is still stronger, older, and male. There's still no way you could fight four angry guys.

Shaking your head, you continue on your way to the mall. It's not much further now. Good thing, too, as your bra is beginning to get uncomfortably warm.

When you arrive at the mall, you quickly notice how you tower over the groups of teenage girls you pass. You notice, also, how some of them watch you go by with narrow, judgmental eyes. You hear at least one remark about your apparently unfashionable attire.

The one good thing is that they're criticizing your clothing, instead of freaking out about a cross-dressed man.

You just try to keep your eyes level and off their bodies, even though some of them are showing a ton of cleavage. It helps when you think that, from their perspective, you may also have cleavage.

That thought is far less comforting when you begin noticing guys checking you out.

Finally, you spot Linda standing where she said she would meet you, at the fountain near the center of the mall, except she's facing the wrong way and her back is to you. Excited again, you rush over to her.

"Linda!" you exclaim. At the sound of your voice, she turns in your direction.

She's about to say your name. But which one?

13222121221112212122.content:
"Umm, no dear. It's getting late and dinners almost ready. Besides, aren't you the one who said you didn't feel good enough to babysit earlier?" your mother says sternly.

"But mum, I'm feeling better now!" you say in a horribly whiny voice.

"Oh , so when it suits you, your fine? Goddamn it Phyllis, I thought your father and I raised you to be more than a lazy liar. In fact your grounded, give me your phone." your mother had always been strict, so you weren't surprised by her abrupt punishment. You feel sick to your stomach as you pass your phone over to her, almost feeling your old life ebbing away. "You can have this back on Wednesday. Now after dinner I want you to wash and go to bed, you have school in the morning anyway." You feel only despair as you sit at the table, now more than ever aware of the bra stretched across your chest and the soft silky material of the dress across your legs.

As your mother serves dinner you can't help but notice how much healthier your dinner looks next to your dads. You, your mother and your sister all have a skinless chicken breast with salad, whereas your father has two breaded pieces of chicken, a mound of mashed potato and a generous dollop of coleslaw on the side. You never liked salad and had grown used to the meals his father ate. You poke at your meal loosely with your fork, before a pang of hunger makes you dig in. Polishing your plate clean in minutes you look up and see your mother nod toward the door.

You trudge up the stairs and into the shower room. You stopped at the door and slam it behind you, gaining some pleasure from the meaningless defiance. With some sense of relief you pull the dress off over your shoulder and toss it into your wash basket. As you step out of your panties and let your bra fall to the floor you feel free for the first time that day. You step into the shower and turn the water on, allowing the warm water to sooth you. You grab at your mothers bodywash and use it, there is no real difference here as you normally used it anyway.

You then use the bottle of shampoo that is left out. As you run your hands through your hair, you can feel your hairs new silky texture. Is it just you or does your hair feel longer? You ignore your new shoulder length, no longer worried about these changes. As you step out of the shower you step onto a towel and dry yourself. You reluctantly wrap a towel around you at chest level, not wanting someone in your family to see your 'breasts'. You open the door and bump into your sister.

"Hey sis! I see you've been using my shampoo..." she says sniffing at your hair. "I told you it works wonders! You hairs gonna be so silky once it's dried properly.

"Uh thanks Susanne" you say amused and quickly race into your room. You quickly set about using the hair dryer, only now really paying attention to your long hair. But your not worried it's just another annoyance to deal with.

Once done you look around and spy a nighty...

You were sitting in the waiting room of Industrial Industries Corp. waiting to be called on for a job interview. You were dressed in nice business attire and impatiently waiting for the young receptionist to call on you. The receptionist was dressed in a simple white blouse, grey suit jacket and matching skirt, and sleek black high heeled shoes. You recognize her as one of the customers at the deli where you used to work. Her name was Amanda and she'd always seemed like a nice young woman.

Today being your birthday only added to your anxiety. Your girlfriend, Naisha, had expressed displeasure at losing you for the afternoon but you swore that you'd make it up to her afterwards. She had driven you here to the interview and dropped you off. She was wearing her favourite pink tank top and an old pair of jeans she's had for years.

You shared your birthday with your little cousin Katie and so your parents were off at her birthday party. No doubt Katie's parents would have rented the waterpark at the edge of town for the party like the do every year.

Your Sister Susan was at the mall today with her friend's. She'd done her own laundry on the weekend and ruined all of her clothes so she had to get new clothes. This gave her just cause to skip out on Katie's party.

You refocus your attention on your up-coming interview. Looking around the room you see that the receptionist had stepped out for a moment. Suddenly you felt a bit light headed. When the sensation faded you were dressed

A sleek black purse was resting on the floor next to where you'd been sitting earlier. You look inside and are relieved to find your phone. There's a woman's wallet, but it contains your drivers license and other cards. You realize Amanda must have your wallet, but with her money and ID.

Amanda is still glaring at you. With no one else in earshot, you try to make nice.

"I don't know how this happened," you say, "but if it makes you feel any better, you look a lot better in my suit than I bet I do in this skirt and heels."

Her expression softened, and it almost looked like she was grinning. "I don't know about that," she said. "You've got legs for days."

You blush, unsure of what to say. You can feel the purse vibrate, and when you pull out your phone, it's Naisha texting to ask how the interview went, and if you can still take her out to eat now. You look up to see Amanda watching you.

"It's, uh, my girlfriend," I say. "She wants to meet me for lunch. What do I do?"

Before Amanda can answer, a middle-aged female executive enters the room. She looks briefly at you, but not with the surprise your outfit deserves, then turns to the receptionist and tells Amanda that she's expecting visitors in 10 minutes and would like them shown directly to her office. Like Mr. Parker and the others, she seems utterly unfazed by what either of you are wearing, and in fact pauses before leaving to tell Amanda, "I like how that tie goes with your suit today!"

You two are alone again. Amanda reflexively straightens her — or, rather, your — necktie, and looks lost in thought.

"Nobody seems to notice that we're wearing each other's clothes," she finally says. "I don't know what else there is to do right now except for you to go see your girlfriend and me to get back to work. Hopefully, when we each get home tonight, our regular clothes will be waiting for us."

"Oh god," you say anxiously. "It never even occurred to me that they wouldn't be!" You give her an awkward wave goodbye and do your best to navigate out of the office in Amanda's pumps. Now all you can think about is what you'll find in your closet at home.

14111212.content:
Amanda watched as Phillip Parker stumbled out of the office wearing her pumps, skirt, and blouse. She still didn't understand how they had suddenly been wearing each other's clothes, nor why no one at the company seemed to notice or care about their clothing swap. After another minute of furiously looking for a solution to their predicament, the phone rang and she had no choice but to answer it and get back to work. She was just a lowly receptionist; she couldn't afford to go home at mid-day to figure out why she was magically cross-dressed.

The hours passed with Amanda doing her job and no one commenting on her suit and tie. She began to notice certain advantages. The office thermostat always ran lower than she would like, and having her legs covered in wool trousers helped keep her a lot warmer than when she was in a skirt. She found her posture changing a bit, her legs splayed out — manspreading, her roommate Caitlyn called it — because she didn't have to worry about anyone getting a look at her underwear. But she was also consciously aware of the layer after layer of clothing she had on. Her torso, for instance, had on an undershirt, then a stiff white dress shirt with a starchy collar, a tight red necktie, suspenders, and the suit jacket itself. And even though no one else was commenting on her transformed attire, it was all she could think about, even as she answered the phone, greeted visitors, and performed her other duties.

Finally, it was quitting time, which she could see on both the clock on the wall and the masculine metal wrist watch Phillip had been wearing when he entered, and that now sat on her left wrist. It had been a very strange day, and Amanda was tempted to go to the nearest bar to have a drink or five. But recalling her earlier discussion with Phillip, she also really wanted to go home to her apartment in the hopes that the rest of her wardrobe had been left untouched by this.
14111212.title: The story follows Amanda for a while

141112122.content:
Booze could wait, Amanda decided, until she was back in a dress — or, at least, in a cute top and some skinny jeans. This boxy suit was unacceptable, and she was nervous that she would find more like it when she got to her apartment.

On the plus side, she found that her commute home a lot easier when she was walking and standing on the bus in low-heeled men's shoes. She missed how her pumps made her legs look, but not the feel of still having them on at the end of a long workday.

She arrived at home to find Caitlyn, a tall and athletic blonde who worked at a law firm, just home from work, her own uncomfortable shoes kicked off, her feet up on their living room coffee table as she scrolled through her phone. Caitlyn looked up when Amanda walked through the door, but like everyone at work, didn't seem to notice anything out of the ordinary.

"Hey, Amanda," she said. "How was work?"

"It was... a little weird," Amanda replied.

"How so?" Caitlyn asked.

"Tell you in a minute," Amanda said, finally loosening her necktie and unbuttoning her shirt's top button. She felt vastly more relaxed just from those two simple gestures. She marched into her bedroom and threw open the closet door, where she found...
141112122.title: Amanda goes home to see if her other clothes ar...

Acted like it was a ridiculous idea
1411121222.content:
Amanda's heart sank as she saw a closet full of shirts, jackets, and pants she didn't recognize — masculine clothes, at that.

Whatever did this to them must have switched all their clothes, she realized. She checked her dresser, and found the same thing: men's t-shirts, jeans, even boxer briefs.

"Great," she muttered. "Just great."

She still desperately wanted to get out of the suit, so she stripped down to her new male underwear, then pulled on a vintage white-on-black bowling shirt and a pair of dark jeans that felt very baggy on her.

In her casual, but still very male, attire, she went back to the living room, where Caitlyn was still barefoot but otherwise dressed in her work clothes.

"Couldn't wait to ditch the ol' suit and tie, eh?" Caitlyn asked when she got a look at Amanda's change of clothes.

"Yeah," Amanda said sheepishly. "You know how it is."

Caitlyn picked her feet up off the coffee table and forced herself to slowly stand up. "I totally do," she replied, and began to unzip her skirt as she walked to her own bedroom. "Let me change real quick and we can go out together."

A thought occurred to Amanda: other than a few inches difference in height, she and Caitlyn were roughly the same build. And even though her own clothes were had been replaced by these boys' things, she could still wear something pretty that belonged to her roommate.

"Hold up, Caitlyn," she called out, right before Caitlyn closed her bedroom door.

"What is it?"

"Would you mind if I borrowed one of your little black dresses to wear out tonight?"

Caitlyn...
1411121222.title: Men's clothes

choices: She goes shopping for more men's clothing
14111212222.content:
Caitlyn laughed nervously at the request.

"Amanda, are you feeling okay?" she asked. "Why on earth would you want to go out in a dress?"

"Because I'm a woman, and women wear dresses when they want to," Amanda said, increasingly anxious about the situation.

"Most women do," Caitilyn replied. "You don't. You're a suit-and-tie, jeans-and-t-shirt, hoodie-and-cargo-pants kinda gal. Always have been. You'd look ridiculous in a dress. Everyone would stare at you! At us!"

Whatever this magic was, Amanda realized, it had gone past altering the clothes she had on, but the kinds of clothes the world expected her to wear. Dejected, dejected she told Caitlyn to hurry up and get dressed. She now really wanted a beer. Or 12.

While Caitlyn got changed, Amanda wandered back into the bedroom and studied what she had inherited from Phillip. Most of it was casual clothing like this. She had the suit she came home in today, and there was a cheap-looking blazer that looked like he'd worn it for senior class picture day in high school, plus a few pairs of khakis. It made sense. He was a few years younger than her, and was interviewing for his first real office job. He didn't own any other suits.

Amanda realized that, while the world was expecting to see her in a suit tomorrow, it wasn't expecting to see her again in THIS suit. Until she could untangle this mess, she needed to upgrade Phillip's — or, for the moment, her — wardrobe.

Or maybe, she thought, she should track him down to try to solve the problem together.
14111212222.title: Acted like it was a ridiculous idea

141112122221.content:
Amanda told a disappointed Caitlyn that she realized she had to go to the mall to do some clothes shopping.

"For men's clothes, I hope?" Caitlyn asked nervously, her mind clearly still on Amanda's earlier request to borrow one of her dresses.

Amanda plastered on a fake smile and said, "Yup! New suits, new shirts, new ties — the works!"

Caitlyn politely declined to join her, so Amanda rode the bus alone to the local mall. It was past rush hour, so she could not only find a seat, but again spread out in her baggy but concealing pants. "I don't hate this part," she thought to herself.

Arriving at the mall, Amanda decided to take another crack at acquiring some more feminine clothes. No dice. The middle-aged sales lady at the first boutique she entered asked if Amanda was shopping for her girlfriend, then blanched when Amanda said she was shopping for herself. "Young lady, we're not... that kind of store," the woman told her, before suggesting Amanda try a shop downtown that catered to drag queens. The clerk at the next store she tried was more amused than put out, but still reacted as if, by wanting to try on skirts and blouses, Amanda was doing something very outside of gender norms.

Finally, she accepted that she had to complete the task for which she originally came to this place. She knew which stores in the mall had the cutest outfits at prices she could afford, but she had no experience buying menswear. She tried browsing the men's section of a few department stores but felt uncomfortable in such big and crowded spaces. She kept wandering around the mall until she came to a small shop she'd never noticed before: Harry's Haberdashery, which in its display window had a mannequin wearing a sharp navy blue pinstripe three-piece suit.

"Wow, I'd look amazing in that," she found herself thinking, much to her surprise.

She wandered inside and was greeted by a well-dressed middle-aged man with a proper English accent. "Welcome to Harry's, young lady," he said with a smile. "I'm Harry himself. How may I help you?"

"Well," Amanda replied anxiously, "I realized I need to expand my work wardrobe, and..."

His eyes lit up. "Oh, you've come to the right place, my dear!" he told her. "We're having a three-for-one sale on everything this week: suits, shirts, ties, shoes, the whole kit and kaboodle!"

"Really?" she asked. "That's great!" She did the mental math in her head and realized she could get by with three new suits, plus the one she'd inherited from Phillip, so long as she mixed and matched the shirts and ties.

"I'm afraid we have to resort to these kinds of promotions to attract business," he confessed. "Not as many people your age are interested in wearing a proper suit. Did you have a particular style in mind? Single-breasted, double-breasted, light, dark...?"

She almost blushed as she pointed at the window mannequin and said, "I really liked that one."

Harry placed a reassuring hand on her shoulder. "Why, you have excellent taste, my dear!" he said. "You'd look positively dashing in that."

"'Dashing,'" Amanda repeated. "Nobody's ever called me that before, but I think I might like that a lot?"

"By the time I'm done kitting you out," he told her, "no other adjective will possibly do."

Harry led her to a back room with an elevated platform in front of a three-way mirror. "Kindly strip down to your underwear so I can take proper measurements," he told her. Under ordinary circumstances, Amanda would be creeped out by such a request from a man, but these were not ordinary circumstances, and something in Harry's gentle tone suggested he really just wanted to get her measurements right.

She tossed aside the shoes, bowling shirt, and jeans and stood on the platform in a man's white undershirt, white briefs, and black dress socks. She should have felt embarrassed, but something about the image seemed right to her. She stretched out her arms and legs as Harry required while he measured her arms, legs, chest, waist, and neck. "And I suppose I should check your hips as well," he added at the end with a smile. "You're not built quite like my usual customers, are you?" She smiled back. For the first time since she'd found herself wearing a strange man's clothes, she felt okay.

Harry fetched her a crisp white shirt and a bright red silk necktie. "These should go well with that navy pinstripe you liked so much," he said, before heading to the display window to undress the mannequin. Amanda stayed in the back and began buttoning up the white shirt. Even before today, she was familiar with men's dress shirts, having worn more than a few after having sex with men. That was flirtatious, though, and the shirts tended to be much too big on her. This one would be hers, and it confirmed Harry's skill by fitting her perfectly everywhere. She felt confident wearing it.

That was nothing, however, compared to how she felt once she slipped on the three-piece suit she'd been admiring, then (with a little help from Harry) put on the red tie in a half-Windsor knot, plus a new pair of black oxford shoes and a red pocket square to match the tie.

"Oh, wow," she said, as she turned this way and that to study her reflections in the mirror. "I almost look too good to be a receptionist."

"You do, indeed, look marvelous, my dear," Harry told her. "And it's like the old saying goes: dress for the job you want. Show up in this tomorrow, and you may not be on the reception desk much longer."

They spent the next hour picking out two more suits and a variety of shirts, ties, belts, and shoes that she could mix and match to create as many looks as she needed at work. As she sat on the bus heading back to her apartment, she couldn't help admiring her purchases, and imagining all the heads she would turn when she strutted into the office tomorrow wearing the pinstripe suit. It was already one of the favorite wardrobe items she'd ever owned, and she was half-tempted to put it back on and wear it to the club to meet Caitlyn.
141112122221.title: She goes shopping for more men's clothing

1411121222212.content:
Amanda liked the people she worked with, and appreciated the security of having steady work, but she usually couldn't shake off the feeling that she was there because someone thought she was pretty — like she was another fancy decoration for the office lobby. And it always made her feel at least a little self-conscious.

Today, though? She strutted into work in her new pinstripe suit like she owned the place. She was only the receptionist, but she felt like a boss — and that's how everyone reacted to her.

"Looking *sharp*, Amanda!" Jill Reeves told her as they rode up in the elevator together.

"That suit's nicer than any I own," quipped Daniel Conner, one of the company's top partners. "My goodness!"

"Damn!" was all that Tony Duncan could say when he saw her setting up at the reception desk.

Ordinarily, any compliments from Daniel, Tony, or any of the other guys in the office would have been tinged with sexualized subtext. They praised her because they thought she was hot, and some of them probably hoped she would go out with them. It didn't feel that way today, though. It felt like the men (and the women, too) were just impressed. It was a really good feeling. Amanda still had no idea how this had happened, but for the moment, she had no complaints.

She went about her usual duties for a few hours until it was almost lunchtime. Daniel swung by and stared at her for a moment — again, not in a creepy way, just him assessing her suit.

"You know, if you had a paisley tie, I think it'd look really striking against those pinstripes," he told her. "Though this one looks great, too."

"Thanks," she replied. "I'll see what I've got on the ol' tie rack at home."

"So can I ask a small favor?" he said.

"Uh-oh," Amanda thought. "Here comes the come on." But when she smiled and asked what it was, it was nothing of the the sort.

"We just hired someone for that entry level position in data," he told her. "He's smart, but he seems awfully anxious for some reason. I thought maybe you could take him out to lunch, tell him about the neighborhood and some of the people, so he knows more than just what we do professionally. Might help him relax into it."

"Oh, that sounds fine," she said, relieved her assumption had been wrong. "Someone will have to cover for me if I'm going out, though. Usually, I just eat at my desk."

Daniel promised to take care of it, and, even better, said she could expense the meal to his company card. This was more trust, or interest, in her than he'd ever shown in the past. She assumed it was the suit, and again grinned at her odd new fortune. And then it occurred to her that the new hire might be Phillip, which would give her another chance to figure out what was happening — or, at least, to see what had become of her old wardrobe.

A few minutes later, Daniel returned with...

14111212222121.content:
Amanda had to stifle a laugh as Phillip stumbled toward her. He was wearing a mismatched collection of her clothes: a baby blue sleeveless satin blouse, a plaid green cardigan, a bright red skirt, and patent leather black peep toe shoes with a three-inch heel. The skirt was something she'd wear to the club, not the office, way too short and tight for the occasion, and showing off much more of his hairy legs than yesterday's outfit had. Like his clothes had been for her, all of her stuff was now sized to fit him, but none of it seemed to be on quite right, and he looked much less comfortable in any of it — the high heels, especially — than she had felt in his suit yesterday, or in this new one today.

"Amanda, this is Phillip Parker," Daniel said.

Phillip gawked at her, looking miserable.

"We met yesterday," she said with a smirk. "I'm so glad you got the job, Phillip. I look forward to working with you."

"Uh, thanks," he replied nervously, his eyes sending her a signal that screamed, "HELP ME!"

She stood up and adjusted her suit jacket, telling Daniel, "Mr. Conner, why don't I take Phillip off your hands so you can get back to work?"

"I don't know what we'd do around here without you, Amanda," Daniel replied with a grin before heading back to his office. No one else was in the reception area, so Amanda finally let out the giggle she'd been holding in.

"Ohmigod, you look ridiculous!" she said as he blushed.

"Thanks," he muttered, then studied her for a moment, puzzled. "But... that's not my suit?"

"You only owned the one you wore here yesterday," she explained. "I needed to upgrade your wardrobe — at least as long as it's my wardrobe."

"You look way better than I do," he lamented. "I didn't look nearly this stupid when we first switched yesterday, I don't think."

She thought about this for a moment. "Yesterday, you were wearing clothes I picked out and had put on correctly. Today, you were on your own."

He looked utterly lost and miserable. "I don't know how this happened! I went home, and my closet was filled with more of your clothes! My girlfriend thinks it's totally normal! Everybody does! And I look ridiculous!"

She took pity on him and patted him on the shoulder. She thought maybe if they thought hard on it together, they could figure out a way to undo this. But she also thought it would be easier to spruce up his current look.

"I know what to do," she said. She had decided to...
14111212222121.title: Phillip, still wearing Amanda's clothes

141112122221212.content:
"Come with me," she said. "I'm going to get you all fixed up for now."

They took the elevator downstairs and headed for the mall that was right near the office. He tried to keep up with her, but her stride was much longer and more assured in her oxfords than his was in pumps. He kept wobbling around until she finally stopped in impatience.

"Didn't anyone teach you how to walk in heels before?" she asked, enjoying his misery more than she felt she should.

"No," he said, downcast. "And they hurt, too!"

"Beauty is pain, sweetheart," she replied. "Now let me see those shoes for a minute."

She kicked off her oxfords and peeled off the argyle socks she was wearing, while he gasped in relief after pulling off the heels. Though these were technically her shoes, they were now a bit too big for her, but she was still able to maneuver around in them, and soon was demonstrating the proper technique: "Heel, toe, heel, toe, heel, toe," she said with each accomplished step. "Now you try."

He grimaced as he put the shoes back on, but his walk was, indeed, much improved, and as she laced up her oxfords, she let out a sarcastic whistle. "Ooohie!" she cried with delight. "You want some fries with that shake?"

He blushed again, but the walk to the mall moved much more quickly. She took him into a department store, and efficiently grabbed a pair of nude stockings, a tube of red lipstick, and a cheap but pretty costume jewelry bracelet.

As she made a beeline for the women's department fitting rooms, he asked, nervously, "What's all of that for?"

"If I could, I'd buy you a whole new matching outfit to wear for today," she explained, "but it would look too weird if you changed clothes midway through your first day. Best I can do is improve this look around the margins, and tomorrow you can come in wearing an outfit I approve of more than this."

A sales clerk rolled her eyes as they entered a fitting room together, perhaps assuming they were a couple looking to fool around. Once the door was closed and locked, Amanda ordered Phillip to strip down to his underwear, which he did reluctantly. She snickered some more when she saw the lacy matching black bra and thong he had selected.

"What's so funny?" he asked, again hating all of this.

"One, that's the kind of thing I'd wear on a date where I expected to have sex — not to the office where it's wildly uncomfortable," she said. "And two, I love that the only thing you wore that matched was the underwear that nobody at the office should see."

As he looked at the floor again, she handed him the stockings and explained how to put them on. He rolled each one up to the edge, stuck it over his big toe, then rolled it up to his thigh.

"Much better!" she said. "Tonight, you should ask your girlfriend to help you shave your legs, but for now, this conceals that hairyness enough to get by."

He winced at the thought of shaving his legs, so she distracted him by helping him put the other clothes back on so they weren't all crooked. She clasped the bracelet to his left wrist, then unscrewed the tube of lipstick.

"Whoa!" he said. "I have to wear makeup, too?"

"Ideally, a lot more than this," she said, "but we don't have time for that right now. Accessories and some makeup will help distract from this clown hooker look you've put together out of my clothes. But even when you're dressed better, you're going to want to use this, maybe some mascara, a bit of blush and foundation..."

She made him purse his lips and applied the lipstick, then showed him how to smack his lips together to complete the look.

"See?" she told him. "Now you're so gorgeous, no one will care about your outfit."

She paid for the purchases, then led Phillip to a nice bistro on the mall's second floor, where she went about the task Daniel had assigned her of telling him about the people at the company, the neighborhood, etc. Every now and then she would laugh and remind him to cross his legs at the ankles to avoid giving passersby a free look at what was beneath his skirt.

He was starting to relax a bit, and as Amanda studied him, she found herself surprisingly attracted to this man wearing her clothes. "It's a shame," she thought, "that he has a girlfriend. We're kind of a matched set."

You keep watching the mother and daughter and observe the mother looking confused as to why she's holding the little girl's hand, the little girl in turn is shocked and doesn't know who her mother, now receptionist, is.

As the child starts crying and the woman starts looking around for the girl's mother you realise that since the swap that... YOU might be perceived as her mother now.

Phew, you thought.

"Isabelle!... Honey!" The voice kept shouting until the woman who had jogged over grabbed you by the shoulders, at which point you dropped the hem of your dress and looked up in surprise.

Suddenly coming back to your senses you decide you can't go with this woman and be her little girl, you're a grown man!

1523322.title: An old folks (retirement) home

info.brief_description: You gain the power to swap the clothes you are wearing with the clothes of a girl you know
info.description:
Your name is Phillip Parker and one day you gain the ability to swap the clothes you are wearing with the clothes that a girl you know is wearing just by thinking about it. Other people don't notice the change except for those you swapped with. The only exception to this rule is if you really want to you can allow someone else to see the changes.

Basic Rules:
1. No personality changes
2. No killing characters
3. The main character gains no other powers
4. the swap must be with someone you know (no celebrities)

Please add and Enjoy!

P.S. The clothes adjust size (but not proportions) to fit you and people think that it is normal for you to wear the clothes you gain in the swap
